rev.desc.rev.desc: Add validation for unicode type
Panel check.type.change.1
change condition from
$L.no.type.change=false and nullsub($L.mssqlunicode.invalid, false)
to
nullsub($L.mssqlunicode.invalid, false)
Add validation for unicode type
Panel new.field.9
line 3 was:
$du.field.index in field in $dbdict={[name in $dbfield, level in $dbfield+1, 1]}
line 3 is:
$du.field.index in field in $dbdict={[name in $dbfield, level in $dbfield+1, 1, , , , , {[, , , ]}]}
This was needed to keep the sql mapping structure correct.
Panel save.field.2
added a strtrml() to remove the leading blanks from the original field name
changed changed $L.temp.name=structure in $dbfield to $L.temp.name=$L.temp.struct on edit.field.sa panel
modifications to make.copy and set.option panels to make sure SQL info fields are NULL when creating an alias field
Removed *3 on the new.field.9 panel.
Changed the padding length to match the main dbdict utility.
Fixed adding a structure to a structure. Was putting first field at wrong position.
properly index and level a new structure when forcing users to add an element to the structure
Adds SQL fields on new/edit dbdict field dialog boxes. Forces user adding a structure to add an element to the structure.
Removed call to obsolete function current.scroll()
panel: set.new
changed expression:
from: $L.lng=lng(denull(field in $dbdict)) - 1
to: $L.lng=lng(denull(field in $dbdict))
also changed the following panels from mb.ok panels to apm.mb.ok panels:
name.exists.msg.ok
name.exists.mb.ok
message.remove.key.first
Fix for table type.
Changed check.type to exit to a mb.ok instead of the mb.yes.no
Put in flags to determine if the field is a structured array or a field that is part of a structured array.
Modified the first line of panel select.field as follows:
Before: $du.field.index=cursor.line(1)
After: $du.field.index=nullsub(cursor.line(1), 2)

Apparently, if record list is on, the cursor.line function gets confused at it does not return the proper line number. The code change made forces it to point to the first field in the dbdict selected by the user.
Added a check to see if the field being deleted has a key associated with it.
Case insensitivity problem fixes.
Modified previous change to only check if the type has changed. Now it should work for next, prevous, or save. StarTeam ticket ST14928
Rearanged the order of the exits on check.type.change.1 panel so that it will exit to warn.before.save.field before it goes to save.field. Before it was only warning part of the time.

Added $du.field.index=nullsub($du.field.index, 1) to the new.field panel to make sure that if the cursor position was null that $du.field.index would have some value. Change was made to the dbdict.field.edit app for Starteam ST14707
Changed field exists message from scmessage 1878 to scmessage 1991
Will no prevent adding duplicate fields instead of just warning.
Now warns user to update data if data exists and data type changes .
Cleanup of previous change to make interface cleaner.

Made changes so that when a field is edited or added it will warn the user if a field name has already been used, and recomend that they use a new field name. It will however, allow the change if the user really wants it.
Made the window open over the full screen, so it won't get lost under the Start Menu on windows systems that are running 800x600 mode.
gui style confirmation boxes
Added scmsg function for internationalization of messages.
Added option to make an alias when editing a field.
When adding a new field, will now make sure that the index is the next highest overall number, not just the next number.
Now adds a properly formatted new record.

descript.descript: Add validation for unicode type
Panel check.type.change.1
change condition from
$L.no.type.change=false and nullsub($L.mssqlunicode.invalid, false)
to
nullsub($L.mssqlunicode.invalid, false)
Add validation for unicode type
Panel new.field.9
line 3 was:
$du.field.index in field in $dbdict={[name in $dbfield, level in $dbfield+1, 1]}
line 3 is:
$du.field.index in field in $dbdict={[name in $dbfield, level in $dbfield+1, 1, , , , , {[, , , ]}]}
This was needed to keep the sql mapping structure correct.
Panel save.field.2
added a strtrml() to remove the leading blanks from the original field name
changed changed $L.temp.name=structure in $dbfield to $L.temp.name=$L.temp.struct on edit.field.sa panel
modifications to make.copy and set.option panels to make sure SQL info fields are NULL when creating an alias field
Removed *3 on the new.field.9 panel.
Changed the padding length to match the main dbdict utility.
Fixed adding a structure to a structure. Was putting first field at wrong position.
properly index and level a new structure when forcing users to add an element to the structure
Adds SQL fields on new/edit dbdict field dialog boxes. Forces user adding a structure to add an element to the structure.
Removed call to obsolete function current.scroll()
panel: set.new
changed expression:
from: $L.lng=lng(denull(field in $dbdict)) - 1
to: $L.lng=lng(denull(field in $dbdict))
also changed the following panels from mb.ok panels to apm.mb.ok panels:
name.exists.msg.ok
name.exists.mb.ok
message.remove.key.first
Fix for table type.
Changed check.type to exit to a mb.ok instead of the mb.yes.no
Put in flags to determine if the field is a structured array or a field that is part of a structured array.
Modified the first line of panel select.field as follows:
Before: $du.field.index=cursor.line(1)
After: $du.field.index=nullsub(cursor.line(1), 2)

Apparently, if record list is on, the cursor.line function gets confused at it does not return the proper line number. The code change made forces it to point to the first field in the dbdict selected by the user.
Added a check to see if the field being deleted has a key associated with it.
Case insensitivity problem fixes.
Modified previous change to only check if the type has changed. Now it should work for next, prevous, or save. StarTeam ticket ST14928
Rearanged the order of the exits on check.type.change.1 panel so that it will exit to warn.before.save.field before it goes to save.field. Before it was only warning part of the time.

Added $du.field.index=nullsub($du.field.index, 1) to the new.field panel to make sure that if the cursor position was null that $du.field.index would have some value. Change was made to the dbdict.field.edit app for Starteam ST14707
Changed field exists message from scmessage 1878 to scmessage 1991
Will no prevent adding duplicate fields instead of just warning.
Now warns user to update data if data exists and data type changes .
Cleanup of previous change to make interface cleaner.

Made changes so that when a field is edited or added it will warn the user if a field name has already been used, and recomend that they use a new field name. It will however, allow the change if the user really wants it.
Made the window open over the full screen, so it won't get lost under the Start Menu on windows systems that are running 800x600 mode.
gui style confirmation boxes
Added scmsg function for internationalization of messages.
Added option to make an alias when editing a field.
When adding a new field, will now make sure that the index is the next highest overall number, not just the next number.
Now adds a properly formatted new record.
